description:
Microtonal zither twangs, off-world vocals and k-hole sonic wonders characterise Martyna Basta's brilliant second album, a crepuscular muddle of improvisations and granular invocations.

Martyna Basta's 'Making Eye Contact With Solitude'Â took us by surprise, demolishing the borders between electro-acoustic experimentation, wyrd folk and ambient music by infusing scholarly expertise with raw, unbounded passion. Its followup pushes even deeper into the unknown, crumpling real-world... more

Collaging fragments of music and field recordings collected over the last 10 years, Christina Vantzou approaches her Longform Editions debut like a personal mixtape, splicing live rehearsals and performances from friends and collaborators with church and insect sounds.Â

label: Room 40
description:
Genius, gothic worldbuilding from longtime spars David Toop and Lawrence English, weaving field recordings, electronics and an arsenal of instruments like some quietly delirious fever dream, where Martin Denny and Jani Christou flex in session with Conny Plank at the controls.

English and Toop first met 20 years ago and the two have long maintained similar ideas about the potential physicality of music. 'The Shell that Speaks the Sea' is a realisation of that years-long conversation, with results... more
